qas.question: Where did the USSOC Pacific deploy to in Jan 2002?
What was the goal of the 2002 Philippines deployment?
What was the main Filipino Islamist group being attacked?
What humanitarian effort followed the 2002 military operation in the Philippines?
What did Operation Smiles do for the Philippines?

answers.text: provide medical care and services to the region of Basilan

qas.question: What island did Abu Islamiyah and Jemaah Sayyaf have a stronghold on?

plausible_answers.text: to provide medical care and services to the region of Basilan as part of a "Hearts and Minds" program.

qas.question: What was the goal of "Smiles Operation?"

plausible_answers.text: Joint Special Operations Task Force – Philippines

qas.question: Who operated under the name "PAMOC Augmentation Team?"
Who was deployed to help the Filipino Islamist groups?
How long had the Abu Sayyaf group been in Basilan?

plausible_answers.text: Joint Special Operations Task Force – Philippines

qas.question: What did PACOM Augmentation Team rename itself as?
What was the name of the operation to remove Abu Sayyaf?
Where was the headquarters of the Armed Forces of the Philippines?

context: In January 2002, the <b9_0>United States Special Operations Command<b9_0/>, Pacific deployed to the <a0_0>Philippines<a0_0/> to advise and assist the Armed Forces of the Philippines in <a1_0>combating Filipino Islamist groups<a1_0/>. The operations were mainly focused on removing the <a2_0>Abu Sayyaf<a2_0/> group and Jemaah Islamiyah (JI) from their stronghold on <b13_0>the island of <b5_0>Basilan<b13_0/><b5_0/>. The second portion of the operation was conducted as a humanitarian program called "<a3_0><b12_0>Operation Smiles<b12_0/><a3_0/>". The goal of the program was <b6_0>to <a4_0>provide medical care and services to the region of Basilan<a4_0/> as part of a "Hearts and Minds" program.<b6_0/> <b7_0><b11_0>Joint Special Operations Task Force – Philippines<b11_0/><b7_0/> disbanded in June 2014, ending a <b10_0>14-year<b10_0/> mission. After JSOTF-P disbanded, as late as November 2014, <b8_0>American forces<b8_0/> continued to operate in the Philippines under the name "PACOM Augmentation Team".
